result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M. MEINELT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Roxicodone), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Defendant is only to consume prescribed drugs and in the prescribed doses.

Continue with any counseling currently engaged in or as recommended by the agent.

Order for Reinstatement of Huber Privileges.
It is hereby ordered:
1) that defendant's Huber privileges are restored as of September 21, 2015.
2) if the defendant has another urinalysis after her huber privileges are restored, her Huber privileges shall be rescinded, without further notice of hearing, for the remainder of her condition time.

Order Withdrawing Huber Privileges ordering that defendant's Huber Privileges be withdrawn without notice as authorized by Section 303.08(2) of the Wisconsin Statutes until her release date on this file.
Sentencing hearing reset for 03-11-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Count 1 - Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Roxicodone) - No contest plea.   
Count 4 - Deliver Heroin - No contest plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, deliver schedule I,II narcotic and count 3, deliver heroin.  Motion granted.  
Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing is set for 03-13-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Report to be filed by 03-02-15.
